Module contents

mymetal.universial.char_to_dic(mycontent_char)

“name:n1 gender:male” =>> {“name”:”n1”, “gender”:”male”}

mymetal.universial.check_input(args=[], check_type='none')

check_input_blank function is not correct, I think it’s useless

first line - check_input_none

second line - check_input_blank

mymetal.universial.check_position(position_strict: ndarray = None, position: ndarray = None) → bool

checking the atom is in ps [xo, xh, yo, yh, zo, zh]

mymetal.universial.dic_to_char(mycontent_dic={}, tag='   ')

f”name:n1 {tag} gender:male” <<= {“name”:”n1”, “gender”:”male”}

mymetal.universial.extract_line_at_position(file, line_number_list, move_list_down_up=[-10, 5])

input is a position list generated by find_line_position()

using my_down_up to enlarge the list controled by move_list_down_up (sorted)

extract the line in position of list

mymetal.universial.find_line_position(file, search_string)

find the serch_string in file

return a list of position of search_string

noted, from 1, not 0. it’s controled by start=1 or start=0

mymetal.universial.fixatoms(atoms: Atoms = None, mask: list = None, indices: list = None) → Atoms

Constrain chosen atoms.

Parameters:

  • indices (list of int) – Indices for those atoms that should be constrained.

  • mask (list of bool) – One boolean per atom indicating if the atom should be constrained or not.

  • list. (To fix some atoms for mask) –

  • ---------- –

  • like (mask=[atom.symbol == 'Cu' for atom in atoms] ===>>> mask = [True, ..., False, ...].) – indices=[atom.index for atom in atomcopy if atom.symbol == ‘Cu’] ===>>> [3, 6, 10, …]. mask = [ atom.position[2] - min(hetero.get_positions()[:,2]) < 5 for atom in hetero].

mymetal.universial.list_to_char(mycontent=[], list_type='char', char_tag='   ', dic_tag='\n', key_value_interval=': ', item_interval=', ')

consisted of two function

list_of_char_to_char to output the list of char to file

list_of_dic_to_char to output the list of dic to file

mymetal.universial.move_atoms(atoms: Atoms = None, translate_matrix: list = [0.1, 0.1, 0.0]) → Atoms
mymetal.universial.my_add_list(list1=[], list2=[])

” combine two list, and sort it

mymetal.universial.my_down_up(list, move_list_down_up=[0, 0])

enlarge list

like [1,4], move_list = [-2,3]

=>> [-1,0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7] (-1, 7)

mymetal.universial.my_pattern_trans(match_type, char='')

generate the regular expression

char to regular expression

mymetal.universial.mydel_pos_type(atoms: Atoms = None, position_strict: ndarray = None, type_strict: array = None) → Atoms

using to delete some atoms in specified region or/and type

ps: [xl, xh, yl, yh, zl, zh]

ts: [‘H’, ‘O’, … ]

temp = mydel_pos_type(temp, [float(‘-inf’), float(‘inf’), float(‘-inf’), float(‘inf’), float(‘-inf’), 0.9])

temp = mydel_pos_type(temp, [float(‘-inf’), float(‘inf’), float(‘-inf’), float(‘inf’), 10.18, float(‘inf’)])

mymetal.universial.myjust(left=True, num=10, output='')

left just or right just of output

num is digit of variable

like ‘dig’ =>> ‘dig ‘ =>> ‘ dig’

return char_out

mymetal.universial.normalize_float_int(value)

Helper function to normalize values

Convert to float and remove trailing zeros, if it’s a float

mymetal.universial.print_after_blank(char_name='', calling_function='', specified_blank='')

combined two lines

print(f”the value is None! - {calling_function}”)

char_out = ‘’

print(f”the value is None! - {calling_function}”)

char_out = ‘’

mymetal.universial.print_after_not_supported(char_name='', calling_function='', specified_blank='')

combined two lines

print(f”the value is None! - {calling_function}”)

char_out = ‘’

mymetal.universial.print_after_read(count_read, stretch_factor=[], special_name='', name='')

note if read all {special_name} - OUTCAR

{name} is class name {self.name}

nead a count_read variable

mymetal.universial.rm_blank(extr_content, remove_string=' ', removed_string='')

for 1-D list, remove blank

like [“reached required accuracy”,”reached required accuracy”] to

[ “reachedrequiredaccuracy” , “reachedrequiredaccuracy” ]
